title: Variadic functions
question: Which of these are true about variadic functions?
hint: Variadic parameters behave much like regular ones, except they are converted to an array inside the function.

correct.answer: A variadic parameter is written with three dots after its type: Int...
Variadic parameters can potentially receive hundreds of values.
correct.reason: They are all given to us as a single array.

correct.answer: Variadic parameters can potentially receive zero values.
correct.reason: The array we're given might be empty.

correct.answer: Variadic parameters are converted into arrays inside your function.

correct.reason: You can pass in as many values as you want, separated by commas.

correct.answer: You can write your own variadic functions.
correct.reason: Just place three dots after the type of one of your parameters.

wrong.answer: Variadic functions only work with integers.
wrong.reason: You can use any type you want.

wrong.answer: Variadic parameters must always have at least one value.
wrong.reason: You can pass in no values if you want.

wrong.answer: Variadic functions are slower than regular functions.
wrong.reason: There is no performance difference between the two.

wrong.reason: You must always pass values individually, separated by commas.
